Things to Do After Landing in Vienna as a Student üá¶üáπ

Published: Mar 18, 2025 |  at  05:06 AM
| Suggest Changes

Arriving in Vienna for studies is exciting but also comes with important steps to ensure a smooth transition. Here‚Äôs a checklist of essential things you need to do as soon as you arrive.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Register Your Residence (Meldezettel)

Within 3 days of your arrival, you must register your address at the Magistrat (MA35) or Meldeamt (registration office).

  • Required Documents:
    • Filled Meldezettel form (signed by your landlord) ‚Üí Download Form
    • Passport
    • Rental contract (if requested)
  • Where to Register?
    • You can register at any Magistratisches Bezirksamt (district office). Find your nearest one here: Wien.gv.at

2Ô∏è‚É£ Open a Bank Account

You‚Äôll need a local Austrian bank account for rent payments, university fees, and daily expenses. Some popular banks for students:

  • Bank Austria (Free student account)
  • Erste Bank (Student-friendly options)
  • Raiffeisen Bank (Youth and student accounts)
  • N26 (Digital banking option)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Get a SIM Card & Mobile Plan

Staying connected is essential. Here are some affordable student-friendly mobile operators:

  • HOT Mobile (Cheap prepaid options)
  • Drei (3) (Budget data plans)
  • A1 (Best coverage, but slightly expensive)
  • LycaMobile (Best for international calls)

4Ô∏è‚É£ Apply for a Public Transport Card (Semester Ticket) üé´

Public transport in Vienna is very efficient. As a student, you can get a Semester Ticket for discounted travel.

  • Where to apply? Wiener Linien Website
  • Cost: ~‚Ç¨78 per semester (for students under 26)
  • Required Documents:
    • University enrollment confirmation
    • Passport

5Ô∏è‚É£ Health Insurance Registration üè•

If you‚Äôre from a non-EU country, you must have Austrian health insurance. The most common student insurance provider is √ñGK (√ñsterreichische Gesundheitskasse).

  • Apply Online: √ñGK Website
  • Cost: ~‚Ç¨66 per month
  • Required Documents:
    • Passport
    • Residence Registration (Meldezettel)
    • University Enrollment Confirmation

6Ô∏è‚É£ Enroll at Your University üìö

Visit your university‚Äôs Student Services Office to finalize your enrollment.

  • Bring:
    • Passport
    • Admission Letter
    • Proof of Payment (Tuition Fee if applicable)
    • Meldezettel (Address Registration)

7Ô∏è‚É£ Explore Accommodation Options üè†

If you haven‚Äôt secured accommodation yet, check:

  • OeAD Student Housing: OeAD Housing
  • Wohnungsboerse: Wohnungsboerse
  • WG-Gesucht (Shared Flats): WG-Gesucht

8Ô∏è‚É£ Register for E-Card (Health Insurance Card)

If you are insured under √ñGK, you will receive an E-Card (Austrian health insurance card). Keep it with you for doctor visits.

9Ô∏è‚É£ Get a City Library Card (Optional) üìñ

Vienna has amazing public libraries where you can borrow books, use study spaces, and access digital resources.

  • Register Online: Stadt Wien B√ºchereien

üîü Join the Bangladeshi Students Community üáßüá©

Stay connected with other Bangladeshi students in Vienna!
Join Our WhatsApp Group

By completing these steps, you‚Äôll be well-prepared for your student life in Vienna. If you have any questions, feel free to ask in our student community!
